PatternGUI:Title: Add Expression Control
PatternGUI:ExpressionDescription: The added Expression components are prioritized lower in the hierarchy.
HandGesturePatternType:LeftOnly:Desc: A pattern using only the left hand. (8 variations)
HandGesturePatternType:RightOnly:Desc: A pattern using only the right hand. (8 variations)
HandGesturePatternType:BasicRight:Desc: A basic pattern prioritizing the right hand. (16 variations)
HandGesturePatternType:BasicLeft:Desc: A basic pattern prioritizing the left hand. (16 variations)
HandGesturePatternType:HandSign:Desc: A pattern that allows up to 64 gesture combinations using both hands. (64 variations)
HandGesturePatternType:Blending:Desc: A pattern that blends animations for each hand. Useful for assigning eye and mouth controls to each hand, etc. (64 variations)
MenuPatternType:ExclusiveMenu:Desc: A sample that generates an exclusive menu.
MenuPatternType:BlendingMenu:Desc: A sample that generates a menu that blends with other expressions.
OtherPatternType:HeadContact:Desc: A sample using contact. Useful for specifying expressions when being patted, etc.
PatternGUI:AC:Desc: Analyzes the animator controller and generates expression controls that behave as closely as possible.
ExpressionDataComponent:Clip:tooltip: This animation clip mainly applies blend shape animations for facial expressions, but can also include other types of animations such as ear movement, which are applied at build time.
ExpressionDataComponent:Import:tooltip: Import an animation clip. The system will still work even if you don't import. Importing converts facial animations to manual settings, and creates a dedicated animation clip for non-facial animations.
ExpressionDataComponent:BlendShapeAnimat: Manual facial animations. Can be used together with animation clips, or you can use only one. If the same blend shape is set in both, the manual setting takes priority.
ExpressionDataComponent:AllBlendShapeAni: Treat all blend shape animations as facial animations
Treat all blend shape animations in the animation clip as facial animations. Useful when handling clips for other avatars with different paths.
ExpressionDataClipImporter:ConfirmCreate: Non-facial animations have been detected. Do you want to create an animation clip to keep the non-facial animations? If you don't, only facial animations will be imported and non-facial animations will not be carried over.
Select a save location for the animation clip for non-facial animations
ExpressionComponent:EnableRealTimePrevie: Enable this to always preview this expression. Only one expression can be active in the avatar at a time.
FacialStyleComponent:BlendShapeAnimation: Settings for facial animations (face style). These settings are applied to all expressions under this GameObject.
FacialStyleComponent:ApplyToRenderer:too: Applies this expression to the SkinnedMeshRenderer at build time. Useful if you want to apply the face style in environments where animation does not work.
FacialStyleComponent:UpdateFromScene:too: Get blend shapes set on the target SkinnedMeshRenderer
FacialStyleComponent:AsDefault:tooltip: Set this expression as the default. This will create a child ExpressionComponent that is always played and affected by this face style. If grayed out, it is already set.
PatternComponent:Description:
This component makes all Expressions under the attached GameObject mutually exclusive.
If the Conditions linked to each Expression are not exclusive, the Expression lower in the hierarchy takes priority.
It is recommended to use this component and set exclusive Conditions.
BlendShapeWeight:Name: Blend Shape Name
ExpressionSettings:LoopTime:tooltip: Enable this to loop the animation. Only effective for multi-frame animations.
ExpressionSettings:MotionTimeParameterNa: Specify the name of the parameter (float) for MotionTime. The playback position of the multi-frame animation will change according to the value of this parameter. Only effective for multi-frame animations with loop OFF.
FacialSettings:AllowLipSync:tooltip: Set whether to enable lip sync when playing this expression. If set to 'Keep', the setting of the lower-priority expression will be used.
FacialSettings:AllowEyeBlink:tooltip: Set whether to enable eye blinking when playing this expression. If set to 'Keep', the setting of the lower-priority expression will be used.
FacialSettings:EnableBlending:tooltip: Set whether to blend with lower-priority expressions. For example, to blend a blink blend shape into the current expression. If OFF, all unspecified blend shapes are set to 0, completely overriding lower-priority expressions. Default is OFF.
ClipImportOption:tooltip: Options for handling facial animations included in the animation clip.
FacialEditor:Base:Title: Base
FacialEditor:Selected:Title: Selected
FacialEditor:Unselected:Title: Unselected
FacialEditor:Target:Title: Target
FacialEditor:Filter:Title: Grouping
FacialEditor:ClipImport:Title: Import Animation Clip
FacialEditor:UnsavedChanges:Title: Unsaved Changes
FacialEditor:UnsavedChanges:Message: This window may have unsaved changes. Would you like to save?
